form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Burr(for himself,Mr. Boozman,Mr. Wicker,Mr. Risch,Mr. Moran,Mr. Chambliss,Mr. Roberts,Mr. Thune,Mr. Enzi,Mr. Vitter,Mr. Crapo, andMr. Inhofe) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the conditions under which certain persons may be treated as adjudicated mentally incompetent for certain purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Second Amendment Protection Act .

section.header: Conditions for treatment of certain persons as adjudicated mentally incompetent for certain purposes

subsection.text: Chapter 55of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Conditions for treatment of certain persons as adjudicated mentally incompetent for certain purposes
section.text: In any case arising out of the administration by theSecretaryof laws and benefits under this title, a person who is mentally incapacitated, deemed mentally incompetent, or experiencing an extended loss of consciousness shall not be considered adjudicated as a mental defective undersubsection (d)(4)or (g)(4) ofsection 922of title 18 without the order or finding of a judge, magistrate, or other judicial authority of competent jurisdiction that such person is a danger to himself or herself or others.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning ofchapter 55 of such titleis amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 5511. Conditions for treatment of certain persons as adjudicated mentally incompetent for certain purposes.
